title: Remove Element
patternTriggers: In-place removal + any order = Two Pointers. Overwrite elements to remove with elements to keep.

approaches.name: Brute Force (Extra Space)
approaches.intuition: Create a new array to store elements that are not equal to val, then copy back to original.
approaches.approach: Use temporary array to collect valid elements, count them, then copy back to original array.
steps: Copy temporary array back to nums

complexity.spaceExplanation: Temporary array for storing valid elements

approaches.name: Better (Single Pointer)
approaches.intuition: Use single pointer to track position for next valid element. Copy valid elements forward.
approaches.approach: Maintain index for placement. When finding valid element, place at index and increment.

approaches.name: Two Pointers - Optimal
approaches.intuition: Track position for next valid element with slow pointer. Fast pointer scans and copies non-val elements to slow position.
approaches.approach: Slow marks insertion position. Fast finds elements != val and copies them to slow position.

commonMistakes: Using extra space when in-place solution required
Worrying about elements after returned length
Trying to remove elements by shifting entire array
hints: Don't need to worry about what's beyond the new length
followUp: Minimize number of operations when val is rare
What if val is very common?
Can you swap from end instead?
relatedProblems: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II
